subject: Fix sensor missing issue.
commitMessage:
Fix sensor missing issue.

There is issue for "BMC randomly unable to get sensor readings".
When invoking "ipmitool sdr" from Linux OS (host), it only
returns three sensors like following partial records:
[root@localhost ~]# ipmitool sdr
CPU Power        | 0 Watts           | ok
Memory Power     | 0 Watts           | ok
Total Power      | 0 Watts           | ok
[root@localhost ~]#

There 2 caches sensorTree and sensorDataRecords.
When sensorDataRecords cache and sensorTree cache is not sync,
which causes this issue, like sensorTree cache has 10 sensors
but there are just 5 sensors in sensorDataRecords cache.
Most important sensorDataRecords cache is not necessary,
ipmiStorageGetSDR could get data from dbus directly and
no any performance impact.

Using sensorMapUpdatePeriod(10s) but not sensorMapSdrUpdatePeriod(60s),
60 seconds are too long to answer user with some SDR content
at the first time of BMC bootup.

Tested:
All sensors could be listed even at booting phase.
Could print correct sensor set along with the boot progress.

root@intel-obmc:~# ipmitool sdr
CPU Power        | 202 Watts         | ok
Memory Power     | 0 Watts           | ok
Total Power      | 312 Watts         | ok
root@intel-obmc:~# ipmitool sdr
System Airflow   | 14 unspecified    | ok
PSU1 In Current  | 1.18 Amps         | ok
PSU1 Out Current | 20.80 Amps        | ok
PSU2 In Current  | 0 Amps            | ok
PSU2 Out Current | no reading        | ns
Pwm 1            | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 2            | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 3            | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 4            | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 5            | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 6            | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 13           | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 14           | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 15           | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm 16           | 29.79 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm PSU1 Fan 1   | 39.98 unspecifi   | ok
Pwm PSU1 Fan 2   | 39.98 unspecifi   | ok
.............
PVCCD HV CPU1    | 1.18 Volts        | ok
PVCCFA EHV FIVRA | 1.16 Volts        | ok
PVCCINFAON CPU1  | 1.11 Volts        | ok
PVCCIN CPU1      | 1.68 Volts        | ok
PVNN PCH AUX     | 1.03 Volts        | ok
root@intel-obmc:~#

Change-Id: I729d9bcbf91f0e96c62fb5f5ebe0240a0eaa47df
Signed-off-by: Kuiying Wang <kuiying.wang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Helen Huang <he.huang@linux.intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Kuiying Wang <kuiying.wang@intel.com>

Patch Set 10:

The major change for this review is to remove the sensorDataRecords cache. ipmiStorageGetSDR is responsible for getting specific SDR. it is OK to get data from DBUS directly without much performance impact. Cache is not necessary. 

Previous GetSensorDataRecords is the routine that reads all sensor data and cache them. Kuiying changed it to  GetSensorDataRecord (no S now) and remove the cache. Instead of caching, it now reads real time data from dbus every time. Since there is no cache any more, there will be no sync issue.

sensorTree and sensorDataRecords  are 2 caches involved in this case. When sensorDataRecords cache and sensorTree cache mismatch for sensors, it causes the issue "BMC randomly unable to get sensor readings".

Patch Set 10:

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> The major change for this review is to remove the sensorDataRecords cache. ipmiStorageGetSDR is responsible for getting specific SDR. it is OK to get data from DBUS directly without much performance impact. Cache is not necessary. 
> 
> Previous GetSensorDataRecords is the routine that reads all sensor data and cache them. Kuiying changed it to  GetSensorDataRecord (no S now) and remove the cache. Instead of caching, it now reads real time data from dbus every time. Since there is no cache any more, there will be no sync issue.
> 
> sensorTree and sensorDataRecords  are 2 caches involved in this case. When sensorDataRecords cache and sensorTree cache mismatch for sensors, it causes the issue "BMC randomly unable to get sensor readings".

You are right Chunhui, thanks a lot for the detail explanation.

Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Unused variable declaration due to the changes in update interval from 60 seconds to 10 seconds
Following code snippet seems to be a copy of ipmiStorageGetSDR. Could we define them as function to avoid duplication?
Ignore this. I read wrong version.

This code is added to optimize the sensor polling time. It makes update sensors only if there is change. Else we store all map in static pointer sensorNumMapPtr and use it.

Removing this code make git big performance. Especially sensor polling is taking huge time and this optimization is needed.

Details::getSensorSubtree() is not only called by getSensorNumMap().

If sensors are updated and then some other function calls details::getSensorSubtree() before getSensorNumMap(), getSensorNumMap() could not get the sensorTreeUpdated flag set, so sensorNumMapPtr could not be updated, andthe functions that rely on sensorNumMapPtr could not get the updated sensors.

Good catch Helen, but at the same time, we need to see possible optimization we can do here. If we do the sensorTree loop for every call, then it is unnecessary. Probably instead returning as boolean for getSensorSubtree, it is better to return an updateIndex (i.e. whenever sensorTreePtr is reset or updated, increment the index and return the same. With this we will know whether the SensorTree data needs to be revisited, whenever the index doesn't match with previous stored static value by the caller.
Thanks Richard, I've uploaded a new patchset as your suggestion.
nit: This can be initialized here.
check the return code for this?
Can you explain the root cause identified and how it is addressed in the comments. That help review the changes.

Without info on root cause of the issue, it is hard to judge whether the change is going to address the issue.
I might be missing something, but looks like only place a new sensorUpdatedIndex will be returned is when sensorTreeUpdated is true and this function was returning true -- so line 133 would function the same without the change.

This function is different from the original sensorTreeUpdated flag.
Since details::getSensorSubtree is called by multiple functions. When the caller needs make sure the SensorSubtree is updated since its last call, it needs compare this sensorUpdatedIndex to with its own static index.

sensorTreeUpdated flag could not fulfill this need. This change comes from Richard's suggestion.
Please refer to the previous comment:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/intel-ipmi-oem/+/40362/4/include/sdrutils.hpp#b138
This change seems to  be fixing a different bug, please add it to commit message

This is for the current bug fix.
The original logic will short out getSensorSubtree() when sensorTree is not empty but updated.
But we need call getSensorSubtree() when sensorTree is updated even though it's not empty.
This will copy the whole map, right? IS efficiency a concern here?
These changes seem to be the critical part of the bug fix.
Will this have the potential to flood the journal?
No need to reset sensor tree when Dbus call failure like dbus busy which do not corrupt sensor tree.

The description here is still not very clear to me. 
1. Is the issue that sensorDataRecords did not reparse sensorTree when new interfaces have been added to dbus?  
2. "getSensorDataRecords not working as expected" is not a clear description that can help review the changes
Is this just to make sensor list available sooner? So eventually sensor list works correctly without the change, right?
It cause long time no sensor shown even bmc already boot-up.
Howis it different from previous logic where getSensorSubtree() return bool(true/false) when there is sensorTreeUpdate?
you could get detail from here https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/intel-ipmi-oem/+/40362/4/include/sdrutils.hpp#b138
Why this is moved down? Need to validate inputs first.

nit: Below code can be refactored in to separate functions, probably in a separate patchset.
Like getting getSensorNumFromRecordID(), updateRecord(), like that so that it will be more readable.

+1, As said, Can be loaded as separate patchset.

So going ahead with +2.
getSensorDataRecord is already a separate function, and below code just used by getSensorDataRecord. So it is ok.
sensorMapSdrUpdatePeriod is no longer used else where. Is it required to retain the variable?
